question: 占める
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>occupy</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to occupy</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What is it you want <vocabulary>to occupy</vocabulary> most in the whole, entire world? Your own flock of <reading>shee</reading>p (<ja>し</ja>). Also, a fortune teller (this kanji also means fortune, remember) told you that if you occupy her sheep, you'll have good luck! Gotta do as she says!
